Shappy, Inc. (“Shappy,” “we,” and “us”) respects the privacy of its users (“you”) and has
developed this Privacy Policy to show its commitment to protecting your privacy. By using our
application (our “Service”), you are accepting the items described in this Privacy Policy. In case
you have any questions, please use the contact information at the end of this Privacy Policy.
What kind of information do we collect?
In order to be a Shappy user, you will be asked to sign in with your Facebook account. If you do
so, you authorize us to access certain Facebook account information, such as your public
Facebook profile (consistent with your privacy settings in Facebook), your email address,
gender, birthday, profile picture, and cover photo. You will be asked to let Shappy use your
location information from your device when you download or use Shappy. In addition, we may
collect and keep any personal information you give while using Shappy. You may also provide
us photos, a personal description, hobbies, interests, status, etc. When you chat with other
Shappy users, we collect the content of your chats, and if you contact us, you provide us with the
content of that communication, as well. You can choose not to provide us with certain
information, but that may result in you being unable to use our Service.
How do we collect your information?
We employ a variety of methods to collect your information for your device and activities
while using Shappy. We automatically collect information from your device when you visit our
Service. This information could include your device ID and type, language, the operating system
used by your device, access times, and your mobile device’s geographic location while our
application is actively running.
How do we use the information we collect?
We may use information that we collect about you to provide and improve our services and
product, and to keep our business going, to manage your account while giving you customer
support, to do analysis about your use of our product, services, or content, to communicate with
you by email, and to enforce any rights in our Terms of Use. We may also use the information to
perform other activities or services as otherwise described to you at the time of collection.
With whom do we share your information?
When you register as a user of Shappy, your Shappy profile can be seen by other users of
our Service. Other users in your range will be able to view the information you have provided to
us directly or through Facebook, such as your Facebook photos, any additional photos you
upload, your first name and surname, your age, approximate number of kilometers away, your
personal description, etc. When another Shappy user contacts you using our Service, you will
only see their genders and horoscopes, and not be able to see their profiles, vice versa. If you and
the other user can keep the conversation and each send at least 23 messages to each other, you
will be able to see the profile of the person contacting you. We do not share your personal
information with others except as indicated in this Privacy Policy. We may share personal
information with services providers for the developmental purposes, law enforcement or other
government agencies due to a court order or a request for cooperation or establishing/exercising
our legal rights and the rights of our users.
How can you access your information?
If you have a Shappy account, you have the ability to review and update your personal
information within the Service by opening your account and going to “Program Settings”. You
also may close your account at any time. If you close your account, we will keep certain
information associated with your account for analytical and legal purposes.
How do we protect your information?
We always take security measures for the well-being of our users, but we know that might
not be enough. Users should also be careful with how they disclose their information.
What about children’s privacy?
We restrict the use of our service to individuals age 13 and above. We do not knowingly
gather, maintain, or employ personal information from children under the age of 13.
What about rights of Third Parties?
This Privacy Policy does not create rights for third parties or require disclosure of any
personal information relating to users of our Service.
What about the changes to this Privacy Policy?
We will occasionally update this Privacy Policy. If we make any changes to this Privacy
Policy, we will notify you of the changes using notifications through the Service.
How can you contact us?
If you have any questions about this Privacy Policy, please contact us by email or postal mail as
